content: The Act may be cited as the "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" and includes an extension and modification of the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property. The "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" amends the Internal Revenue Code to update the eligibility criteria for solar energy and fuel cell property, extending the investment tax credit to 2017 and 2016 respectively. Additionally, excess energy storage devices are now included as eligible energy property. The "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" updates the eligibility criteria for solar energy and fuel cell property, extending the investment tax credit. Solar lighting equipment using solar energy to illuminate structures is now included as eligible energy property. The "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" expands the eligibility criteria for solar energy and fuel cell property, extending the investment tax credit. Solar lighting equipment can now illuminate structures using fiber-optic distributed sunlight. Amendments to the tax code specify that the solar photovoltaic energy property credit is determined solely by kilowatt capacity. The energy credit for solar photovoltaic energy property under section 46 is $1,500 for each half kilowatt of capacity, applicable when the property is used to generate electricity and placed in service during the taxable year. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include rules for property rehabilitation or subsidies, with conforming amendments to specified credits against the Alternative Minimum Tax. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include rules for property rehabilitation or subsidies, with conforming amendments to specified credits against the Alternative Minimum Tax. The amendments made by this section shall take effect on January 1, 2007, except for property placed in service after December 31, 2006. Extension and modification of credit for residential energy efficient property. Extension and modification of the credit for residential energy-efficient property under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Subsection (g) of section 25D is amended to extend the termination date to 2016. The credit percentage for solar electric property is amended to remove the 30 percent limit. The maximum credit for any taxable year is set at $1,500 per half kilowatt. The tax credit for residential energy-efficient property has been extended and modified under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The credit now includes $1,500 for each half kilowatt of installed capacity of qualified solar electric property, $2,000 for qualified solar water heating property expenditures, and $500 for each half kilowatt of capacity of qualified fuel cell property. The definition of qualified solar water heating property has been clarified. The definition of qualified solar water heating property expenditure has been amended to include cooling and providing hot water. The definition of qualified photovoltaic property expenditure now includes advanced energy storage systems. The tax credit against alternative minimum tax has been modified under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to limit the tax credit against alternative minimum tax for the taxable year. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to allow for the carryforward of unused tax credits to the succeeding taxable year. Amendments have been made to sections 25D, 23(b)(4)(B), and 24(b)(3)(B) of the Code. Section 24(b)(3)(B) and Section 26(a)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended to include sections 25D in addition to 23 and 25B. These amendments apply to expenditures in taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. SEC. 4. 3-YEAR ACCELERATED DEPRECIATION PERIOD FOR SOLAR ENERGY PROPERTY AND FUEL CELL PROPERTY. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include new clauses regarding property descriptions under section 48(a)(3)(A). The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include new clauses regarding property descriptions under section 48(a)(3)(A). The amendments made by this section apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2006.
